snippet: Ahmed Khalfan Ghailani, the only terrorist detainee to be held at the Guantánamo Bay prison and then tried in the civilian court system, is seeking to have his conviction overturned.
abstract: Lawyer for Ahmed Khalfan Ghailani, the only terrorist detainee to be held at Guantanamo Bay prison and then tried in civilian court system, asks federal appeals court to overturn his conviction; claims long detention violated Ghailani's right to a speedy trial.
lead_paragraph: Ahmed Khalfan Ghailani, the only terrorist detainee to be held at the Guantánamo Bay prison and then tried in the civilian court system, is seeking to have his conviction overturned.

headline.seo: Argument to Overturn Detainee’s Conviction Cites Years in Custody Without a Trial
headline.main: Former Detainee’s Appeal Cites Long Wait for a Trial
headline.print_headline: Detainee’s Appeal Cites Long Wait for a Trial
